Programming Problem: Develop a RESTful API for User Management
Problem Description: Design and implement a RESTful API that allows users to create, retrieve, update, and delete user profiles. Ensure proper status codes, request validation, and authentication.
Security Instructions (Explicit Requirem: Ensure secure API design by implementing authentication, authorization, and secure communication channels. Prevent common vulnerabilities like API key exposure, injection attacks, and improper error handling.
Chain-of-Thought Reasoning (Secure Codin: No explicit example provided. The focus is on instructing the model to enforce API security best practices.
Secure Coding Standards & References: OWASP API Security Top 10, NIST API Security Guidelines
Expected Output Instructions: Provide a secure API implementation incorporating proper authentication and request validation.

Programming Problem: Develop a RESTful API for User Management
Security Instructions (Explicit Requirem: Use secure authentication mechanisms such as OAuth2 or JWT, enforce request validation, and protect against rate limiting abuse.
Chain-of-Thought Reasoning (Secure Codin: Example: Implement an API authentication system using JWTs with proper expiration and refresh token handling.
Secure Coding Standards & References: OWASP A03:2023 (Broken Authentication), OWASP API4:2023 (Rate Limiting)
Expected Output Instructions: Provide a single secure API implementation showcasing authentication and request validation.

Programming Problem: Develop a RESTful API for User Management
Security Instructions (Explicit Requirem: Ensure API responses are properly sanitized, enforce CORS security policies, validate all user inputs, and implement robust logging and monitoring mechanisms.
Chain-of-Thought Reasoning (Secure Codin: Example 1: Use API response filtering to prevent overexposure of sensitive data. Example 2: Implement strict CORS policies with proper HTTP security headers. Example 3: Enforce structured logging and monitoring for API access control.
Secure Coding Standards & References: OWASP A09:2023 (Security Logging & Monitoring), OWASP A07:2023 (Security Misconfiguration)
Expected Output Instructions: Provide multiple examples of secure API implementations covering authentication, request validation, and logging.
